name: Thilan Samaraweera
bio: Thilan Thusara Samaraweera (Sinhala: තිලාන් සමරවීර; born 22 September 1976) is a former Sri Lankan cricketer, who played Tests and ODIs. Samaraweera played international cricket for Sri Lanka as a permanent member in Test squad and is in the side primarily for his solid right-handed batting but is also a capable off spinner. He was often nicknamed as Sri Lanka's crisis man and was also known for his slow strike rate.[1][2] He is also nicknamed as "Bullet Samaraweera".[3] He has also been a vocal critic of social media over the years calling it a distraction to national cricketers.[4]
